definition: (of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb
muscle/tendon/veins visible under the skin/sth resembling tendons or veins (e.g. fiber in a vegetable)

sentences.english: His mind reached after an understanding of the problem.
sentences.chinese: 他開動腦筋，想弄懂這個問題。

sentences.english: So I need to do something intelligent to exercise my brain.
sentences.chinese: 所以我得做點開動腦筋的事情讓大腦也得到鍛鍊。
開動腦筋，爲劇本想些點子。

sentences.english: Solve your urgent problems with a little creativity.
sentences.chinese: 所以在解決緊急問題時動動腦筋。

sentences.english: The second was not to rush unthinkingly to grab a small profit.
sentences.chinese: 第二個教訓是不要不動腦筋地急於抓住蠅頭小利。

sentences.english: They seldom labour their wits on thankless task.
sentences.chinese: 他們很少爲喫力不討好的工作動腦筋。

sentences.english: It is necessary to strengthen environmental awareness and use our brains.
sentences.chinese: 要加強環境保護意識，開動腦筋。

sentences.english: You should limber up your wits before the test.
sentences.chinese: 在測驗之前你該動動腦筋。

sentences.english: This difficulty challenges my mind to find an answer.
sentences.chinese: 這個困難促使我開動腦筋去尋找答案。

sentences.english: I will be crazy by doing such non-brain using work.
sentences.chinese: 整天做這種不用動腦筋的工作，會讓我發瘋的。

sentences.english: Don't you ever think at all?
sentences.chinese: 你從來都不動腦筋思考的嗎？

sentences.english: Do the without thinking job will make me crazy.
sentences.chinese: 整天做這種不用動腦筋的工作，會讓我發瘋的。

sentences.english: Under those unwritten laws, people were naturally reluctant to use their brains.
sentences.chinese: 在這種不成文法底下，人們就不願意去動腦筋了。

clever and eloquent (idiom); fluent/having the gift of the gab
to push oneself forward/to seek fame/to be in the limelight/same as 出鋒頭|出锋头[chu1 feng1 tou5]
in high spirits (idiom); glowing with health and vigor
to churn out large quantities without regard for quality (idiom); rough and slipshod work
to get straight to the point (idiom)
